info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 2:58AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Laurens, Greenville, Spartanburg, north central Anderson and northeastern Pickens Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 258 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Pickens to 14 miles southeast of Greenville Downtown. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Spartanburg, Easley, Pickens, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors and Simpsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
